item.description: @j_knifed @dick_nixon @tompeyer Sorry, no disrespect intended. Iâ€™m just wondering how current and former soldiers, even those who arenâ€™t involved in highly classified material, are likely to feel about this.

item.description: @j_knifed @dick_nixon @tompeyer I mean more emotionally. I know that Basic Training provided a strong emotional respect for oneâ€™s rifle. How would a WWII naval officer get ingrained with a culture of respecting classified info?

item.description: @trekonomics @joshtpm Sadly, the FBI has again interfered with Mar-a-Lago's desire for transparency by taking away all the best declassified documents.
item.source:markdown: @trekonomics @joshtpm Sadly, the FBI has again interfered with Mar-a-Lago's desire for transparency by taking away all the best declassified documents.

item.description: @joshtpm I would like to see someone call up Rahm Emanuel or Jack Lew and ask them about how classified materials came into the Oval Office and how they left it. What sort of materials crossed the CIC's desk And what the volume of paper generated in a typical week was.
item.source:markdown: @joshtpm I would like to see someone call up Rahm Emanuel or Jack Lew and ask them about how classified materials came into the Oval Office and how they left it. What sort of materials crossed the CIC's desk And what the volume of paper generated in a typical week was.

item.description: @jh_swanson Let me know when they start boycotting products whose kosher supervision relies on the halachic rulings of someone who is racist, homophobic, and misogynist.

item.description: @trekonomics I really believe he just petulantly refused to put stuff in the to-archive bin. Why should he follow regulations?

item.description:
@trekonomics The problem with imputing motives (not a necessity for this crime) is that he could have returned the documents when asked while keeping photos of the important documents.

@trekonomics Thatâ€™s why I think itâ€™s pure inability to accept authority.

item.description:
@Jacob_Labendz Thoughts: 1) The Mishna was ostensibly a product of pagan Rome. 2) It sort of depends on what going on religiously with the rest of the Roman Empire. Pre-Christian Judaism seems to have been somewhat compelling in pre-Christian Rome.

@Jacob_Labendz 3) Poul Anderson has a story, "In the House of Sorrows," that looks at a 20th century Europe where Judaism didn't survive the first Exile and thus there was no Christianity.

@Jacob_Labendz 4) If you like Jewish counterfactuals, check out Other Covenants, an anthology of Jewish alternate history stories and poems, now on Kickstarter: https://t.co/EsaEUeqFp0
Beloved Conservative Relative has suggested that Trump may be getting the Dreyfus treatment by the FBI. Howâ€™s your morning going?
item.source:markdown: Beloved Conservative Relative has suggested that Trump may be getting the Dreyfus treatment by the FBI. Howâ€™s your morning going?
